weatherForecast.comment: Lots of clouds in early morning, summits frequently shrouded in fog, then during the morning hours improving visibility, sunshine emerging. In the afternoon, convective clouds and brief showers possible, also thunderstorms in the Allgau Alps, snowfall level at 2000m. At 2000m: +2 degreres. Initially strong southerly winds, later slackening off noticeably.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh snowdrifts at high altitudes, wet avalanches during daytime
avalancheActivity.comment: As a result of foehn winds, fresh snowdrifts are accumulating on high-altitude shady slopes which are often prone to triggering. One sole winter sports enthusiast can trigger small slab avalanches in such zones. Apart from the danger of being buried in snow masses, the risks of being swept along and forced to take a fall require adequate caution. On steep grass-covered slopes where snow is sufficient, small, in isolated cases medium-sized glide-snow avalanches can be releases, esp. on steep sun-bathed slopes slides and small-to-medium sized wet-snow avalanches are possible.

snowpackStructure.comment: On steep shady slopes at high altitudes, the most recent fresh fallen snow lies deposited atop soft, expansively metamorphosed layers, bonding mostly good. The foehn-impacted nocturnal hours will be mild, clouds often hampering outgong longwave radiation so that only a breakable crust can form on the snowpack surface. Steep high-altitude north-facing slopes often still have powder snow. Mostly shallow old snowpack surfaces are generally well consolidated. On sunny slopes, the uppermost layers often moisten during daytime hours, at lower altitudes the ground becomes bare of snow. Below 1500m there is little snow on the ground.

tendency.highlights: Wet-snow avalanches during course of day. Snowdrifts increasingly stabilizing.

On sunny slopes, the uppermost layers often moisten during daytime hours, at lower altitudes the ground becomes bare of snow. Below 1500m there is little snow on the ground.

customData.generalHeadline: Fresh snowdrifts at high altitudes, daytime warming: caution
